information: Post Malone has received five nominations for the 60th Academy of Country Music (ACM) Awards, scheduled for May 8, 2025. His nominations include Album of the Year for "F-1 Trillion," and three nominations for his collaboration with Morgan Wallen, "I Had Some Help." He is not nominated for the top category, Entertainer of the Year. Key competitors include first-time nominee Ella Langley, who leads with eight nominations. Other heavily nominated artists are Morgan Wallen and Lainey Wilson with seven nominations each, and Chris Stapleton with six nominations.

forecast.time_left_until_outcome_known: 16 days (outcome will be known on May 8, 2025)
forecast.status_quo_outcome: Post Malone wins at least one award given his multiple nominations
forecast.no_outcome_scenario: Post Malone loses in all of his nominated categories despite having 5 nominations, with awards going to competitors like Ella Langley, Morgan Wallen, Lainey Wilson, or Chris Stapleton who collectively have more nominations. Vote splitting across his multiple nominations or his relative newcomer status in country music could result in him being shut out entirely.
forecast.yes_outcome_scenario: Post Malone wins at least one of his 5 nominations, most likely either Album of the Year for 'F-1 Trillion' or one of the three awards for his collaboration 'I Had Some Help' with Morgan Wallen. The Wallen collaboration's popularity and Post Malone's crossover appeal help secure at least one win.
forecast.rationale: Post Malone has 5 nominations at the 60th ACM Awards (note: question states 4, but research indicates 5), providing multiple opportunities to win. His nominations include the prestigious Album of the Year category and three nominations for his Morgan Wallen collaboration 'I Had Some Help.' While facing stiff competition from heavily nominated artists (Ella Langley with 8, Morgan Wallen and Lainey Wilson with 7 each, Chris Stapleton with 6), multiple nominations significantly increase the probability of winning at least one award. Historical patterns at major awards shows suggest artists with 4-5 nominations frequently convert at least one into a win. The Morgan Wallen collaboration is particularly promising given Wallen's strong standing in country music (7 total nominations). However, Post Malone is not nominated for Entertainer of the Year, suggesting he may not be viewed as a top-tier country artist yet. My forecast is not higher because: (1) the competition is exceptionally strong this year, (2) Post Malone is relatively new to country music which may affect voter preferences, and (3) multiple nominations don't guarantee a win. My forecast is not lower because: (1) 5 nominations provide substantial odds through multiple chances, (2) the Wallen collaboration benefits from an established country star's popularity, and (3) an Album of the Year nomination represents significant recognition. I would update higher if pre-ceremony momentum or critical acclaim strongly favored his album or collaboration, or lower if industry commentary suggested voter skepticism about his country music credentials.

prompt:
You are a professional forecaster interviewing for a job.

Your interview question is:
Will Post Malone win an award at the 60th Academy of Country Music Awards?

Question background:
The awards are scheduled to be held on May 8, 2025. Malone has 4 nominations.


This question's outcome will be determined by the specific criteria below. These criteria have not yet been satisfied:
This question resolves as **Yes** if Post Malone wins an award at the [60th Academy of Country Music Awards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/60th_Academy_of_Country_Music_Awards).




Your research assistant's report says:
Post Malone has received five nominations for the 60th Academy of Country Music (ACM) Awards, scheduled for May 8, 2025. His nominations include Album of the Year for "F-1 Trillion," and three nominations for his collaboration with Morgan Wallen, "I Had Some Help." He is not nominated for the top category, Entertainer of the Year. Key competitors include first-time nominee Ella Langley, who leads with eight nominations. Other heavily nominated artists are Morgan Wallen and Lainey Wilson with seven nominations each, and Chris Stapleton with six nominations.

Today is 2025-04-22.

Before answering you think:
(a) The time left until the outcome to the question is known.
(b) The status quo outcome if nothing changed.
(c) A brief description of a scenario that results in a No outcome.
(d) A brief description of a scenario that results in a Yes outcome.
(e) You write your rationale remembering that good forecasters put extra weight on the status quo outcome since the world changes slowly most of the time. Explain your reasoning and the evidence behind your forecast in detail. Summarise information your received from your research assistant that influences your forecast (if any). Explain why your forecast is not higher, and why it is not lower. Outline what would need to be true for you to update your forecast in either direction.
(f) The last thing you write is your final probabilistic forecast as a number between 0 and 100.

# OUTPUT SCHEMA
{
    "time_left_until_outcome_known": "string",
    "status_quo_outcome": "string",
    "no_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "yes_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "rationale": "string",
    "probability": "number" (0-100)
}
